profile.label: Skeptic
profile.description: You trust forensics and patterns over words. You question narratives until the evidence aligns.

reasoning: Foreign male DNA under the victim’s fingernails.
Unidentified fingerprints (secondary handler) on the wine bottle.
Witness + CCTV alignment: a male presence trailing the victim.
contradictions: Depression, debts, and despair in recent weeks.
The torn note could foreshadow self-harm.
Staggered ingestion may include voluntary doses.
Murder.closing: Your choice shows a rigorous, evidence-driven mind. Still, you may be under-weighting Clara’s inner state.

Undetermined.title: Your Verdict: Undetermined

profile.label: Realist
profile.description: You accept ambiguity when the balance of clues resists a clean answer.

reasoning: Internal factors (despair) and external traces (DNA, prints) conflict.
Locked-room context without clear forced entry.
contradictions: Either narrative requires assumptions not fully supported by the file.
Undetermined.closing: Caution and patience are strengths. Many real cases close on this edge of doubt.

title: The Last Appointment
fullSolutionText: You traced the timing, inconsistencies, and pharmacology. Dr. Sienna Hale is the killer.

reveal.motive: Professional rivalry and risk management; the victim had warned that someone was in her files.
reveal.method: A lethal Triazolam dose potentiated by wine, staged as a locked-room self-harm.
evidence: CCTV shows Hale entering at 19:59 and no recorded exit before TOD.
Vial with no prints; unknown partial on the glass.
Door locked from inside; spare unlabeled key in the desk; phone missing.
reveal.epilogue: You didn’t just name the killer—you proved the motive and the method. Case closed.

incorrect.generic: Close—recheck CCTV timing (19:59), the toxicology, and the locked-door staging.

bySuspect.lucien blake: Last appointment is a red herring. CCTV shows a woman entering at 19:59, and the pharmacology points elsewhere.
bySuspect.alan ridge: Emotional motive aside, the sedative dose and staged room require clinical access and knowledge.
bySuspect.mara cole: Paperwork anomalies ≠ homicide. Who actually lied about being in the building?

title: The Justice Cutter
prompt: Match each finger to the correct Judgment title.

items.label: Ring — loyalty, vows, complicity in silence

fullSolutionText: Five fingers, five judgments. The Cutter’s message condemns society’s approval of harm, blind faith, scornful indifference, loyal silence, and the abandonment of innocence.

reveal.motive: Each victim embodies a moral failure symbolized by a finger.
reveal.method: Controlled sedation and staged restraint; post-mortem digit removal as ritual.
evidence: Thumb: society’s quiet approval / looking away.
Index: false accusation and weaponized blame.
Middle: mockery, cruelty, and unrepentant harm.
Ring: closeness that enables betrayal through silence.
Pinky: innocence left unprotected—seen, yet ignored.
timeline: I → II → III → IV → V — one hand, five cuts.
Each scene: disabled logs/cameras, red mark, post-mortem severing.
reveal.epilogue: Justice, this time, arrived as a hand of five cuts.

incorrect.generic: Some matches are wrong. Reconsider each symbol’s meaning and the case titles.
